Detailed Description

Encapsulate a subspace containing a set of coordinates, usually used for computing properties of a set of degenerate coordinates, e.g. T1 irrep of tetrahedral.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CoordinateSubspace::CoordinateSubspace ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule >  mol  ) 

Initializes an empty coordinate subspace.

Parameters:
mol The molecule the coordinate subspace is built on

Member Function Documentation

void CoordinateSubspace::addCoordinate ( boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate >  coord  ) 

Adds a coordinate to the subspace. Currently no sanity checks are done to make sure the coordinate fits the subspace.

Parameters:
coord The coordinate to add

double CoordinateSubspace::character ( boost::intrusive_ptr< SymmetryOperation >  oper  ) 

Computes the character of a symmetry operation. The characters are computed by choosing the coordinate number 0 as a representative for the subspace.

Parameters:
oper The symmetry operation to compute the character of
Returns:
The character
Exceptions:
GigideException Throw if subspace is empty

int Countable::decref (  )  [inherited]

boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate > CoordinateSubspace::getCoordinate ( int  i  ) 

Fetches the ith coordinate in the subspace. This numbering is relative to the subspace, not the complete set of coordinates.

Parameters:
i The coordinate number to fetch
Returns:
The ith coordinate
Exceptions:
GigideException if coordinate number is greater the order() - 1

int Countable::incref (  )  [inherited]

int CoordinateSubspace::order (  ) 

Order = 1 for abelian irreps
Order = 2 for E irreps
Order = 3 for T irreps, etc...

Returns:
The number of coordinates in the subspace

void gigide::CoordinateSubspace::printCharacters ( std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr< SymmetryOperation > > &  opers,
std::ostream &  os = std::cout 
)

Computes and prints the characters of a set of symmetry operations.

Parameters:
opers The set of operations to compute characters for
os The ostream to print to
Exceptions:
GigideException Throws if subsapce is empty

VectorPtr CoordinateSubspace::projection ( VectorPtr  bvec  ) 

Computes the projection of a vector onto the coordinate subspace. This assume orthogonality of the vectors in the subspace. This will give an incorrect answer due to non-orthogonal overcounting otherwise. This may be fixed in future versions.

Parameters:
bvec The vector to project onto
Returns:
The vector projection
